pageContext.claim: “We're thinking about building the wall as a solar wall so it creates energy and pays for itself. ... Pretty good imagination, right? Good? My idea. So, we have a good shot.”
pageContext.analysis: Experts say this is an unworkable idea. With less than 2 percent of the U.S. population living within 40 miles of the Mexico border, the electricity generated by the wall would mostly be useless — unless costly transmission lines were built to take the electricity to other areas of the country. Moreover, this idea was proposed by some researchers before Trump started talking about it publicly.
